body:
joy of beta testing:)

There is ongoing work on `nfsmount` with some changes not committed to main branch yet.

Can you try https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-7973-nfs-server-ids/v1.68.0-beta.8195.877f8d586.fix-7973-nfs-server-ids/

which sorts out some ownership/premission problems.

You might be also interested in:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/7973

All together I think it is a bit risky to be used - at least on macOS. 

"Classic" mount with FUSE-T is IMO preferable way to go on macOS - at least for time being.

I did notice this while investigation #7973 but I thought it was just Linux NFS being a bit flaky.

The OS caches the NFS handles (which are like an identifier for files) and between the beta and v1.67.0 we changed the way those handles are made.

I suspect you were running v1.67.0 then upgraded to the beta which means the OS had the old handles cached.

So you might find a reboot fixes the problem - it would be helpful if you could try that.

I am trying to make the nfs server robust in general for v1.68 not just for macOS so this is a very timely report.

I tried https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-7973-nfs-server-ids/v1.68.0-beta.8195.877f8d586.fix-7973-nfs-server-ids/ and had the exact same problems.  The debug log entries also look the same:

```
2024/08/22 10:37:32 DEBUG : : Lstat:
2024/08/22 10:37:32 DEBUG : : >Lstat: fi=/, err=<nil>
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : [NFS DEBUG] request: RPC #2004141070 (nfs.Access)
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: FromHandle: handle=51347680B3E549A0B3C2FE9165921D04
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: >FromHandle: path=[], err=Invalid file handle
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : [NFS DEBUG] request: RPC #2004141071 (nfs.Access)
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: FromHandle: handle=51347680B3E549A0B3C2FE9165921D04
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: >FromHandle: path=[], err=Invalid file handle
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : [NFS DEBUG] request: RPC #2004141072 (nfs.Access)
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: FromHandle: handle=51347680B3E549A0B3C2FE9165921D04
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: >FromHandle: path=[], err=Invalid file handle
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : [NFS DEBUG] request: RPC #2004141073 (nfs.Access)
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: FromHandle: handle=51347680B3E549A0B3C2FE9165921D04
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: >FromHandle: path=[], err=Invalid file handle
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : [NFS DEBUG] request: RPC #2004141074 (nfs.Access)
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: FromHandle: handle=51347680B3E549A0B3C2FE9165921D04
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: >FromHandle: path=[], err=Invalid file handle
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : [NFS DEBUG] request: RPC #2004141075 (nfs.Access)
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: FromHandle: handle=51347680B3E549A0B3C2FE9165921D04
2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: >FromHandle: path=[], err=Invalid file handle

2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: >FromHandle: path=[], err=Invalid file handle

2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: FromHandle: handle=51347680B3E549A0B3C2FE9165921D04

2024/08/22 10:37:34 DEBUG : nfs: >FromHandle: path=[], err=Invalid file handle
2024/08/22 10:37:37 DEBUG : [NFS DEBUG] request: RPC #2004141081 (nfs.GetAttr)
2024/08/22 10:37:37 DEBUG : nfs: FromHandle: handle=2A27BA72EDAC4B6CAB98FC3A5BF1F4EB
2024/08/22 10:37:37 DEBUG : nfs: >FromHandle: path=[], err=<nil>
```

Yes, I've been comparing 1.67 with 1.68 but rebooting made no difference between them.

Also, the `mount` command is missing in the 1.68.0 beta that I was using.

Trying it in the build you pointed me at (above) gives an error:

`2024/08/22 10:37:57 Fatal error: failed to mount FUSE fs: mount stopped before calling Init: mount failed: cgofuse: cannot find FUSE`

I'll re-read the docs as I'm probably missing FUSE on my machine.
Both macFUSE and FUSE-T require administrator privileges to install, which I don't have on my Mac. Looks like the `mount` command isn't an option for me.

> Both macFUSE and FUSE-T require administrator privileges to install

Not really for FUSE-T, as per the latest [release notes](https://github.com/macos-fuse-t/fuse-t/releases/tag/1.0.38):
```
fuse-t can now be installed without root permissions to a local user home:
installer -pkg fuse-t-macos-installer-1.0.37.pkg -target CurrentUserHomeDirectory
```
You can get `pkg` file from releases.

I have not tried it myself but probably you have to set env PATH for rclone to find it. Let us know if it works. Can be useful for others.

Thanks for the pointer to the release notes! The main page didn't give this info and trying to install from the PKG was also asking for admin permissions.

I managed to get fuse-t installed, but it doesn't work right away.

For others trying this, I also had to create a symlink:

`ln -s $HOME/Library/Application\ Support/fuse-t/lib/libfuse-t-1.0.38.dylib /usr/local/lib/libfuse-t.dylib`

Once the symlink was in place, I was able to run the `rclone mount` command and confirm that the permission issues I reported went away.

I'm beta testing the Files.com integration but was unable to test that with this branch. I'm assuming that if the permission problems went away for aws and pcloud then they'll also go away for Files.com.

Thanks for your help!

> For others trying this, I also had to create a symlink:

Brilliant! Thank you for sharing details.

@kapitainsky can you reproduce the original issue here? Maybe swap between v1.67.0 and [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/)? I can't reproduce it on linux at all any more. I'm worried I've done something wrong with the NFS handle changes I did but I can't figure out what.

Thank you :-)

> @kapitainsky can you reproduce the original issue here?

Yes something does not work with the latest beta:

```
$ rclone-beta nfsmount OD01-ENC: ~/Temp/mount --vfs-cache-mode=full -vv
2024/08/27 09:59:40 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.68.0-beta.8241.0e5eb7a9b" starting with parameters ["rclone-beta" "nfsmount" "OD01-ENC:" "/Users/kptsky/Temp/mount" "--vfs-cache-mode=full" "-vv"]
2024/08/27 09:59:40 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "OD01-ENC:"
...
```

Some (random? I can not see any pattern) directories are not accessible:

```
$ cd ~/Temp/mount/arc_rcc
~/Temp/mount/arc_rcc$ cd RPi-images/
-bash: cd: RPi-images/: Stale NFS file handle
```

It all works with rclone v1.67 (but using MS Office #7973)
Thanks for the confirmation @kapitainsky and the new info that it could be different directories. I've obviously broken something subtle here so will try harder to replicate and fix.

@kapitainsky I can't replicate this :-(

Can you do a bisect for me to try to find the commit which causes the problem? It should be using the same code to generate the file handles so I don't understand why it is breaking. It might be that ce7dfa075c9286bf73d579f81d6f40f3fd1a01ec which upgraded the library is actually the problem, or it might be 70e8ad456fcc627f57c001aa82ac925bd9fb47a8 or 55b9b3e33a1c98740a6e5994ec093b2b553d7458 or something else entirely!

> Can you do a bisect for me to try to find the commit which causes the problem?

Here you are. Something else indeed:)

```
28ba4b832d009133d51d7dc742040f07b590c8b0 is the first bad commit
commit 28ba4b832d009133d51d7dc742040f07b590c8b0 (HEAD)
Author: Nick Craig-Wood <nick@craig-wood.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 3 19:20:43 2024 +0100

    serve nfs: convert options to new style

 cmd/serve/nfs/nfs.go | 24 ++++++++++++++++++------
 1 file changed, 18 insertions(+), 6 deletions(-)
```

Thank you @kapitainsky - exactly what I needed.

I've been testing this with `rclone serve nfs` but the problem is with `rclone nfsmount` as became clear after investigating that commit.

Can you and @claudio-tinnirello-filescom give this a try please?

[v1.68.0-beta.8242.7771456cb.fix-7973-nfs-server-ids](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-7973-nfs-server-ids/v1.68.0-beta.8242.7771456cb.fix-7973-nfs-server-ids/) on branch [fix-7973-nfs-server-ids](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-7973-nfs-server-ids) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

> Can you and @claudio-tinnirello-filescom give this a try please?
> 
> [v1.68.0-beta.8242.7771456cb.fix-7973-nfs-server-ids](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-7973-nfs-server-ids/v1.68.0-beta.8242.7771456cb.fix-7973-nfs-server-ids/) on branch [fix-7973-nfs-server-ids](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-7973-nfs-server-ids) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

```
$ git rev-parse --short HEAD
7771456cb
```

works now. All dirs are accessible again as with rclone v1.67

But no change as for  #7973
